CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 9, 1960, pg. 20, reads: "Charm Class Closes - The Dickson Charm School, which is a YMCA program feature, graduated this group of charmers on Sunday afternoon. First row, left to right: James M. Williams, Joyce Finch, Katherine Dickerson, Mrs. Agnes E. Dickson, instructor; Virginia Coleman, Helen Mabin and Eulacile King. Back row: Martha Richardson, Beverly Smith, Katie Lumslen, Lavorda Jeffries, Mrs. Willa Mae Rice, guest speaker; Nan Ingram, Helen Delts, Barbara Coleman and Esther Cheatham. Atty. Byrd S. Brown, chairman of the YMCA board of directors, awarded certificates to the graduates. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Dickson Charm School participants, first row from left: James M. Williams, Joyce Finch, Katherine Dickerson, instructor Agnes E. Dickson, Virginia Coleman, Helen Mabin, Eulacile King; back row: Martha Richardson, Beverly Smith, Katie Lumslen, Lavorda Jeffries, speaker Willa Mae Rice, Nan Ingram, Helen Delts, Barbara Coleman, and Esther Cheatham posed in front of Henry O. Tanner painting "Christ and His Mother," in Centre Avenue YMCA
